question: Which gas makes up most of Earth's atmosphere?

content.source_1: The lower atmosphere (the homosphere) is well mixed, so the relative proportions of its major gases are fairly uniform worldwide up to around 80 km altitude.
content.source_2: At sea level, dry air contains about 21% oxygen (O2) by volume.
content.source_3: At sea level, dry air contains about 78% nitrogen (N2) by volume.
content.source_4: Oxygen is the component of air that supports combustion and human respiration; flames are extinguished and normal breathing is impaired if oxygen concentration falls well below normal levels.
content.source_5: In ordinary open air, materials can burn and humans breathe without supplemental oxygen.
content.source_6: Nitrogen is comparatively unreactive under normal conditions and does not support combustion.
